Associative Law
A law of composition on a set $M$ is said to be associative if $(ab)c = a(bc)$ for all elements $a, b, c \in M$.
Order of an element
The order of an element $a$ in a group $G$ is defined as the order of the cyclic group generated by $a$ in $G$. It is the smallest positive integer $m$ such that $a^{m}=1$.
Coefficient of a Polynomial

Given a polynomial f=
sum a_i X^i in R[X], the i-th coefficient a_i is called the coefficient of degree i.
System of Generators of an Ideal

Let $\mathfrak{a}$ be an ideal of a ring $R$. A family $\left(a_{i}\right)_{i \in I}$ of elements in $\mathfrak{a}$ is called a system of generators of $\mathfrak{a}$ if $\mathfrak{a}=\sum_{i \in I} R a_{i}$, i.e., if $\mathfrak{a}$ coincides with the ideal generated by the family $\left(a_{i}\right)_{i \in I}$.
Factor Ring

Let $R$ be a ring and $\mathfrak{a}$ an ideal in $R$. The factor ring, or residue class ring, $R / \mathfrak{a}$, is defined initially as an abelian group by viewing $\mathfrak{a}$ as a (normal) subgroup of the additive group of $R$. The elements of $R / \mathfrak{a}$ are all residue classes of type $x+\mathfrak{a}$ for $x \in R$, where addition is given by $(x+\mathfrak{a})+(y+\mathfrak{a})=(x+y)+\mathfrak{a}$ and multiplication by $(x+\mathfrak{a}) \cdot(y+\mathfrak{a})=(x \cdot y)+\mathfrak{a}$. The ring properties of $R$ carry over to $R / \mathfrak{a}$.
Submodule
Submodules of an A-module M are defined similarly to subspaces in vector spaces, where a submodule N of M is a subset that is closed under the operations of M.
Torsion submodule
The torsion submodule T of an A-module M consists of all torsion elements of M. If T = 0, M is called torsion-free; if T = M, it is called a torsion module.
Finite Ring Homomorphism

A ring homomorphism $\varphi: A \longrightarrow B$ is finite if $B$ is a finite $A$-module under $\varphi$. This is also referred to as $B$ being finite over $A$ or, if $\varphi$ is an inclusion homomorphism, that the extension $A \hookrightarrow B$ is finite.
Algebraic closure of a field
An algebraic closure of a field $K$, denoted as $\bar{K}$, is an algebraically closed field that is algebraic over $K$.
Galois extension
An extension $K_{r} / K$ is Galois if it is both normal and separable.
Symmetric Group
The symmetric group, denoted as $\mathfrak{S}_{n}$, is the group of all bijective self-maps of the set $\{1, \ldots, n\}$.
